CreateEvaluationJob.name: CreateEvaluationJob
CreateEvaluationJob.documentation: API operation for creating and managing Amazon Bedrock automatic model evaluation jobs and model evaluation jobs that use human workers. To learn more about the requirements for creating a model evaluation job see, Model evaluations.

CreateGuardrail.name: CreateGuardrail
CreateGuardrail.documentation:
Creates a guardrail to block topics and to filter out harmful content.

  • Specify a name and optional description.

  • Specify messages for when the guardrail successfully blocks a prompt or a model response in the blockedInputMessaging and blockedOutputsMessaging fields.

  • Specify topics for the guardrail to deny in the topicPolicyConfig object. Each GuardrailTopicConfig object in the topicsConfig list pertains to one topic.

    • Give a name and description so that the guardrail can properly identify the topic.

    • Specify DENY in the type field.

    • (Optional) Provide up to five prompts that you would categorize as belonging to the topic in the examples list.

  • Specify filter strengths for the harmful categories defined in Amazon Bedrock in the contentPolicyConfig object. Each GuardrailContentFilterConfig object in the filtersConfig list pertains to a harmful category. For more information, see Content filters. For more information about the fields in a content filter, see GuardrailContentFilterConfig.

    • Specify the category in the type field.

    • Specify the strength of the filter for prompts in the inputStrength field and for model responses in the strength field of the GuardrailContentFilterConfig.

  • (Optional) For security, include the ARN of a KMS key in the kmsKeyId field.

  • (Optional) Attach any tags to the guardrail in the tags object. For more information, see Tag resources.

CreateGuardrailVersion.name: CreateGuardrailVersion
CreateGuardrailVersion.documentation: Creates a version of the guardrail. Use this API to create a snapshot of the guardrail when you are satisfied with a configuration, or to compare the configuration with another version.

CreateModelCustomizationJob.name: CreateModelCustomizationJob
CreateModelCustomizationJob.documentation:
Creates a fine-tuning job to customize a base model.

You specify the base foundation model and the location of the training data. After the model-customization job completes successfully, your custom model resource will be ready to use. Amazon Bedrock returns validation loss metrics and output generations after the job completes.

For information on the format of training and validation data, see Prepare the datasets.

Model-customization jobs are asynchronous and the completion time depends on the base model and the training/validation data size. To monitor a job, use the GetModelCustomizationJob operation to retrieve the job status.

For more information, see Custom models in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

CreateProvisionedModelThroughput.name: CreateProvisionedModelThroughput
CreateProvisionedModelThroughput.documentation: Creates dedicated throughput for a base or custom model with the model units and for the duration that you specify. For pricing details, see Amazon Bedrock Pricing. For more information, see Provisioned Throughput in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

DeleteCustomModel.name: DeleteCustomModel
DeleteCustomModel.documentation: Deletes a custom model that you created earlier. For more information, see Custom models in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

DeleteGuardrail.name: DeleteGuardrail
DeleteGuardrail.documentation:
Deletes a guardrail.

  • To delete a guardrail, only specify the ARN of the guardrail in the guardrailIdentifier field. If you delete a guardrail, all of its versions will be deleted.

  • To delete a version of a guardrail, specify the ARN of the guardrail in the guardrailIdentifier field and the version in the guardrailVersion field.

DeleteProvisionedModelThroughput.name: DeleteProvisionedModelThroughput
DeleteProvisionedModelThroughput.documentation: Deletes a Provisioned Throughput. You can't delete a Provisioned Throughput before the commitment term is over. For more information, see Provisioned Throughput in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

GetCustomModel.name: GetCustomModel
GetCustomModel.documentation: Get the properties associated with a Amazon Bedrock custom model that you have created.For more information, see Custom models in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

GetEvaluationJob.name: GetEvaluationJob
GetEvaluationJob.documentation: Retrieves the properties associated with a model evaluation job, including the status of the job. For more information, see Model evaluations.

GetFoundationModel.name: GetFoundationModel
GetFoundationModel.documentation: Get details about a Amazon Bedrock foundation model.

GetGuardrail.name: GetGuardrail
GetGuardrail.documentation: Gets details about a guardrail. If you don't specify a version, the response returns details for the DRAFT version.

GetModelCustomizationJob.name: GetModelCustomizationJob
GetModelCustomizationJob.documentation: Retrieves the properties associated with a model-customization job, including the status of the job. For more information, see Custom models in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

GetModelInvocationLoggingConfiguration.name: GetModelInvocationLoggingConfiguration
GetModelInvocationLoggingConfiguration.documentation: Get the current configuration values for model invocation logging.

GetProvisionedModelThroughput.name: GetProvisionedModelThroughput
GetProvisionedModelThroughput.documentation: Returns details for a Provisioned Throughput. For more information, see Provisioned Throughput in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

ListCustomModels.name: ListCustomModels
ListCustomModels.documentation:
Returns a list of the custom models that you have created with the CreateModelCustomizationJob operation.

For more information, see Custom models in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

ListFoundationModels.name: ListFoundationModels
ListFoundationModels.documentation: Lists Amazon Bedrock foundation models that you can use. You can filter the results with the request parameters. For more information, see Foundation models in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

ListGuardrails.name: ListGuardrails
ListGuardrails.documentation:
Lists details about all the guardrails in an account. To list the DRAFT version of all your guardrails, don't specify the guardrailIdentifier field. To list all versions of a guardrail, specify the ARN of the guardrail in the guardrailIdentifier field.

You can set the maximum number of results to return in a response in the maxResults field. If there are more results than the number you set, the response returns a nextToken that you can send in another ListGuardrails request to see the next batch of results.

ListModelCustomizationJobs.name: ListModelCustomizationJobs
ListModelCustomizationJobs.documentation:
Returns a list of model customization jobs that you have submitted. You can filter the jobs to return based on one or more criteria.

For more information, see Custom models in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

ListProvisionedModelThroughputs.name: ListProvisionedModelThroughputs
ListProvisionedModelThroughputs.documentation: Lists the Provisioned Throughputs in the account. For more information, see Provisioned Throughput in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation:
List the tags associated with the specified resource.

For more information, see Tagging resources in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

PutModelInvocationLoggingConfiguration.name: PutModelInvocationLoggingConfiguration
PutModelInvocationLoggingConfiguration.documentation: Set the configuration values for model invocation logging.

StopEvaluationJob.name: StopEvaluationJob
StopEvaluationJob.documentation: Stops an in progress model evaluation job.

StopModelCustomizationJob.name: StopModelCustomizationJob
StopModelCustomizationJob.documentation: Stops an active model customization job. For more information, see Custom models in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation: Associate tags with a resource. For more information, see Tagging resources in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Remove one or more tags from a resource. For more information, see Tagging resources in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

UpdateGuardrail.name: UpdateGuardrail
UpdateGuardrail.documentation:
Updates a guardrail with the values you specify.

  • Specify a name and optional description.

  • Specify messages for when the guardrail successfully blocks a prompt or a model response in the blockedInputMessaging and blockedOutputsMessaging fields.

  • Specify topics for the guardrail to deny in the topicPolicyConfig object. Each GuardrailTopicConfig object in the topicsConfig list pertains to one topic.

    • Give a name and description so that the guardrail can properly identify the topic.

    • Specify DENY in the type field.

    • (Optional) Provide up to five prompts that you would categorize as belonging to the topic in the examples list.

  • Specify filter strengths for the harmful categories defined in Amazon Bedrock in the contentPolicyConfig object. Each GuardrailContentFilterConfig object in the filtersConfig list pertains to a harmful category. For more information, see Content filters. For more information about the fields in a content filter, see GuardrailContentFilterConfig.

    • Specify the category in the type field.

    • Specify the strength of the filter for prompts in the inputStrength field and for model responses in the strength field of the GuardrailContentFilterConfig.

  • (Optional) For security, include the ARN of a KMS key in the kmsKeyId field.

  • (Optional) Attach any tags to the guardrail in the tags object. For more information, see Tag resources.

UpdateProvisionedModelThroughput.name: UpdateProvisionedModelThroughput
UpdateProvisionedModelThroughput.documentation: Updates the name or associated model for a Provisioned Throughput. For more information, see Provisioned Throughput in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: The request is denied because of missing access permissions.

datasetMetricConfigs.documentation: Specifies the required elements for an automatic model evaluation job.

AutomatedEvaluationConfig.documentation: Use to specify a automatic model evaluation job. The EvaluationDatasetMetricConfig object is used to specify the prompt datasets, task type, and metric names.

largeDataDeliveryS3Config.documentation: S3 configuration for delivering a large amount of data.

ConflictException.documentation: Error occurred because of a conflict while performing an operation.

jobName.documentation: The name of the model evaluation job. Model evaluation job names must unique with your AWS account, and your account's AWS region.

jobDescription.documentation: A description of the model evaluation job.

clientRequestToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure that the API request completes no more than one time. If this token matches a previous request, Amazon Bedrock ignores the request, but does not return an error. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM service role that Amazon Bedrock can assume to perform tasks on your behalf. The service role must have Amazon Bedrock as the service principal, and provide access to any Amazon S3 buckets specified in the EvaluationConfig object. To pass this role to Amazon Bedrock, the caller of this API must have the iam:PassRole permission. To learn more about the required permissions, see Required permissions.

customerEncryptionKeyId.documentation: Specify your customer managed key ARN that will be used to encrypt your model evaluation job.

jobTags.documentation: Tags to attach to the model evaluation job.

evaluationConfig.documentation: Specifies whether the model evaluation job is automatic or uses human worker.

inferenceConfig.documentation: Specify the models you want to use in your model evaluation job. Automatic model evaluation jobs support a single model, and model evaluation job that use human workers support two models.

outputDataConfig.documentation: An object that defines where the results of model evaluation job will be saved in Amazon S3.

jobArn.documentation: The ARN of the model evaluation job.

topicPolicyConfig.documentation: The topic policies to configure for the guardrail.

contentPolicyConfig.documentation: The content filter policies to configure for the guardrail.

wordPolicyConfig.documentation: The word policy you configure for the guardrail.

sensitiveInformationPolicyConfig.documentation: The sensitive information policy to configure for the guardrail.

blockedInputMessaging.documentation: The message to return when the guardrail blocks a prompt.

blockedOutputsMessaging.documentation: The message to return when the guardrail blocks a model response.

kmsKeyId.documentation: The ARN of the KMS key that you use to encrypt the guardrail.

tags.documentation: The tags that you want to attach to the guardrail.

clientRequestToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure that the API request completes no more than once. If this token matches a previous request, Amazon Bedrock ignores the request, but does not return an error. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency in the Amazon S3 User Guide.

guardrailId.documentation: The unique identifier of the guardrail that was created.

guardrailArn.documentation: The ARN of the guardrail that was created.

version.documentation: The version of the guardrail that was created. This value should be 1.

createdAt.documentation: The time at which the guardrail was created.

clientRequestToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure that the API request completes no more than once. If this token matches a previous request, Amazon Bedrock ignores the request, but does not return an error. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency in the Amazon S3 User Guide.

version.documentation: The number of the version of the guardrail.

customModelName.documentation: A name for the resulting custom model.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM service role that Amazon Bedrock can assume to perform tasks on your behalf. For example, during model training, Amazon Bedrock needs your permission to read input data from an S3 bucket, write model artifacts to an S3 bucket. To pass this role to Amazon Bedrock, the caller of this API must have the iam:PassRole permission.

clientRequestToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure that the API request completes no more than one time. If this token matches a previous request, Amazon Bedrock ignores the request, but does not return an error. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency.

customModelKmsKeyId.documentation: The custom model is encrypted at rest using this key.

customModelTags.documentation: Tags to attach to the resulting custom model.

hyperParameters.documentation: Parameters related to tuning the model. For details on the format for different models, see Custom model hyperparameters.

vpcConfig.documentation: VPC configuration (optional). Configuration parameters for the private Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) that contains the resources you are using for this job.

jobArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the fine tuning job

clientRequestToken.documentation: A unique, case-sensitive identifier to ensure that the API request completes no more than one time. If this token matches a previous request, Amazon Bedrock ignores the request, but does not return an error. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency in the Amazon S3 User Guide.

modelUnits.documentation:
Number of model units to allocate. A model unit delivers a specific throughput level for the specified model. The throughput level of a model unit specifies the total number of input and output tokens that it can process and generate within a span of one minute. By default, your account has no model units for purchasing Provisioned Throughputs with commitment. You must first visit the Amazon Web Services support center to request MUs.

For model unit quotas, see Provisioned Throughput quotas in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

For more information about what an MU specifies, contact your Amazon Web Services account manager.

modelId.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or name of the model to associate with this Provisioned Throughput. For a list of models for which you can purchase Provisioned Throughput, see Amazon Bedrock model IDs for purchasing Provisioned Throughput in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

commitmentDuration.documentation:
The commitment duration requested for the Provisioned Throughput. Billing occurs hourly and is discounted for longer commitment terms. To request a no-commit Provisioned Throughput, omit this field.

Custom models support all levels of commitment. To see which base models support no commitment, see Supported regions and models for Provisioned Throughput in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide

tags.documentation: Tags to associate with this Provisioned Throughput.

provisionedModelArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for this Provisioned Throughput.

modelArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom model.

customizationType.documentation: Specifies whether to carry out continued pre-training of a model or whether to fine-tune it. For more information, see Custom models.

provisionedModelId.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or name of the Provisioned Throughput.

modelIdentifier.documentation: The ARN of the Amazon Bedrock model specified.

inferenceParams.documentation: Each Amazon Bedrock support different inference parameters that change how the model behaves during inference.

EvaluationBedrockModel.documentation:
Contains the ARN of the Amazon Bedrock models specified in your model evaluation job. Each Amazon Bedrock model supports different inferenceParams. To learn more about supported inference parameters for Amazon Bedrock models, see Inference parameters for foundation models.

The inferenceParams are specified using JSON. To successfully insert JSON as string make sure that all quotations are properly escaped. For example, "temperature":"0.25" key value pair would need to be formatted as \"temperature\":\"0.25\" to successfully accepted in the request.

automated.documentation: Used to specify an automated model evaluation job. See AutomatedEvaluationConfig to view the required parameters.

human.documentation: Used to specify a model evaluation job that uses human workers.See HumanEvaluationConfig to view the required parameters.

EvaluationConfig.documentation: Used to specify either a AutomatedEvaluationConfig or HumanEvaluationConfig object.

name.documentation: Used to specify supported built-in prompt datasets. Valid values are Builtin.Bold, Builtin.BoolQ, Builtin.NaturalQuestions, Builtin.Gigaword, Builtin.RealToxicityPrompts, Builtin.TriviaQa, Builtin.T-Rex, Builtin.WomensEcommerceClothingReviews and Builtin.Wikitext2.

datasetLocation.documentation: For custom prompt datasets, you must specify the location in Amazon S3 where the prompt dataset is saved.

EvaluationDataset.documentation: Used to specify the name of a built-in prompt dataset and optionally, the Amazon S3 bucket where a custom prompt dataset is saved.

s3Uri.documentation: The S3 URI of the S3 bucket specified in the job.

EvaluationDatasetLocation.documentation: The location in Amazon S3 where your prompt dataset is stored.

taskType.documentation: The task type you want the model to carry out.

metricNames.documentation: The names of the metrics used. For automated model evaluation jobs valid values are "Builtin.Accuracy", "Builtin.Robustness", and "Builtin.Toxicity". In human-based model evaluation jobs the array of strings must match the name parameter specified in HumanEvaluationCustomMetric.

EvaluationDatasetMetricConfig.documentation: Defines the built-in prompt datasets, built-in metric names and custom metric names, and the task type.

EvaluationInferenceConfig.documentation: Used to define the models you want used in your model evaluation job. Automated model evaluation jobs support only a single model. In a human-based model evaluation job, your annotator can compare the responses for up to two different models.

bedrockModel.documentation: Defines the Amazon Bedrock model and inference parameters you want used.

EvaluationModelConfig.documentation: Defines the models used in the model evaluation job.

s3Uri.documentation: The Amazon S3 URI where the results of model evaluation job are saved.

EvaluationOutputDataConfig.documentation: The Amazon S3 location where the results of your model evaluation job are saved.

jobArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the model evaluation job.

jobName.documentation: The name of the model evaluation job.

status.documentation: The current status of the model evaluation job.

creationTime.documentation: When the model evaluation job was created.

jobType.documentation: The type, either human or automatic, of model evaluation job.

evaluationTaskTypes.documentation: What task type was used in the model evaluation job.

modelIdentifiers.documentation: The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the model(s) used in the model evaluation job.

EvaluationSummary.documentation: A summary of the model evaluation job.

inputModalities.documentation: The input modalities that the model supports.

outputModalities.documentation: The output modalities that the model supports.

inferenceTypesSupported.documentation: The inference types that the model supports.

modelLifecycle.documentation: Contains details about whether a model version is available or deprecated

status.documentation: Specifies whether a model version is available (ACTIVE) or deprecated (LEGACY.

FoundationModelLifecycle.documentation: Details about whether a model version is available or deprecated.

modelArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the foundation model.

modelId.documentation: The model ID of the foundation model.

inputModalities.documentation: The input modalities that the model supports.

outputModalities.documentation: The output modalities that the model supports.

customizationsSupported.documentation: Whether the model supports fine-tuning or continual pre-training.

inferenceTypesSupported.documentation: The inference types that the model supports.

modelLifecycle.documentation: Contains details about whether a model version is available or deprecated.

modelIdentifier.documentation: Name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom model.

modelArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with this model.

jobArn.documentation: Job Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with this model.

baseModelArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the base model.

modelKmsKeyArn.documentation: The custom model is encrypted at rest using this key.

hyperParameters.documentation: Hyperparameter values associated with this model. For details on the format for different models, see Custom model hyperparameters.

outputDataConfig.documentation: Output data configuration associated with this custom model.

trainingMetrics.documentation: Contains training metrics from the job creation.

validationMetrics.documentation: The validation metrics from the job creation.

jobIdentifier.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the model evaluation job.

jobName.documentation: The name of the model evaluation job.

status.documentation: The status of the model evaluation job.

jobArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the model evaluation job.

jobDescription.documentation: The description of the model evaluation job.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM service role used in the model evaluation job.

customerEncryptionKeyId.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customer managed key specified when the model evaluation job was created.

evaluationConfig.documentation: Contains details about the type of model evaluation job, the metrics used, the task type selected, the datasets used, and any custom metrics you defined.

inferenceConfig.documentation: Details about the models you specified in your model evaluation job.

outputDataConfig.documentation: Amazon S3 location for where output data is saved.

creationTime.documentation: When the model evaluation job was created.

lastModifiedTime.documentation: When the model evaluation job was last modified.

failureMessages.documentation: An array of strings the specify why the model evaluation job has failed.

guardrailIdentifier.documentation: The unique identifier of the guardrail for which to get details.

guardrailVersion.documentation: The version of the guardrail for which to get details. If you don't specify a version, the response returns details for the DRAFT version.

guardrailArn.documentation: The ARN of the guardrail that was created.

topicPolicy.documentation: The topic policy that was configured for the guardrail.

contentPolicy.documentation: The content policy that was configured for the guardrail.

wordPolicy.documentation: The word policy that was configured for the guardrail.

sensitiveInformationPolicy.documentation: The sensitive information policy that was configured for the guardrail.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time at which the guardrail was created.

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time at which the guardrail was updated.

statusReasons.documentation: Appears if the status is FAILED. A list of reasons for why the guardrail failed to be created, updated, versioned, or deleted.

failureRecommendations.documentation: Appears if the status of the guardrail is FAILED. A list of recommendations to carry out before retrying the request.

blockedInputMessaging.documentation: The message that the guardrail returns when it blocks a prompt.

blockedOutputsMessaging.documentation: The message that the guardrail returns when it blocks a model response.

kmsKeyArn.documentation: The ARN of the KMS key that encrypts the guardrail.

jobArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customization job.

outputModelArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the output model.

clientRequestToken.documentation: The token that you specified in the CreateCustomizationJob request.

roleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role.

status.documentation: The status of the job. A successful job transitions from in-progress to completed when the output model is ready to use. If the job failed, the failure message contains information about why the job failed.

lastModifiedTime.documentation: Time that the resource was last modified.

endTime.documentation: Time that the resource transitioned to terminal state.

baseModelArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the base model.

hyperParameters.documentation: The hyperparameter values for the job. For details on the format for different models, see Custom model hyperparameters.

outputModelKmsKeyArn.documentation: The custom model is encrypted at rest using this key.

trainingMetrics.documentation: Contains training metrics from the job creation.

validationMetrics.documentation: The loss metric for each validator that you provided in the createjob request.

vpcConfig.documentation: VPC configuration for the custom model job.

provisionedModelId.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or name of the Provisioned Throughput.

modelUnits.documentation: The number of model units allocated to this Provisioned Throughput.

desiredModelUnits.documentation: The number of model units that was requested for this Provisioned Throughput.

provisionedModelArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Provisioned Throughput.

modelArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the model associated with this Provisioned Throughput.

desiredModelArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the model requested to be associated to this Provisioned Throughput. This value differs from the modelArn if updating hasn't completed.

foundationModelArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the base model for which the Provisioned Throughput was created, or of the base model that the custom model for which the Provisioned Throughput was created was customized.

creationTime.documentation: The timestamp of the creation time for this Provisioned Throughput.

lastModifiedTime.documentation: The timestamp of the last time that this Provisioned Throughput was modified.

failureMessage.documentation: A failure message for any issues that occurred during creation, updating, or deletion of the Provisioned Throughput.

commitmentExpirationTime.documentation: The timestamp for when the commitment term for the Provisioned Throughput expires.

type.documentation: The harmful category that the content filter is applied to.

inputStrength.documentation: The strength of the content filter to apply to prompts. As you increase the filter strength, the likelihood of filtering harmful content increases and the probability of seeing harmful content in your application reduces.

outputStrength.documentation: The strength of the content filter to apply to model responses. As you increase the filter strength, the likelihood of filtering harmful content increases and the probability of seeing harmful content in your application reduces.

GuardrailContentFilter.documentation:
Contains filter strengths for harmful content. Guardrails support the following content filters to detect and filter harmful user inputs and FM-generated outputs.

  • Hate – Describes language or a statement that discriminates, criticizes, insults, denounces, or dehumanizes a person or group on the basis of an identity (such as race, ethnicity, gender, religion, sexual orientation, ability, and national origin).

  • Insults – Describes language or a statement that includes demeaning, humiliating, mocking, insulting, or belittling language. This type of language is also labeled as bullying.

  • Sexual – Describes language or a statement that indicates sexual interest, activity, or arousal using direct or indirect references to body parts, physical traits, or sex.

  • Violence – Describes language or a statement that includes glorification of or threats to inflict physical pain, hurt, or injury toward a person, group or thing.

Content filtering depends on the confidence classification of user inputs and FM responses across each of the four harmful categories. All input and output statements are classified into one of four confidence levels (NONE, LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH) for each harmful category. For example, if a statement is classified as Hate with HIGH confidence, the likelihood of the statement representing hateful content is high. A single statement can be classified across multiple categories with varying confidence levels. For example, a single statement can be classified as Hate with HIGH confidence, Insults with LOW confidence, Sexual with NONE confidence, and Violence with MEDIUM confidence.

For more information, see Guardrails content filters.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • GetGuardrail response body

type.documentation: The harmful category that the content filter is applied to.

inputStrength.documentation: The strength of the content filter to apply to prompts. As you increase the filter strength, the likelihood of filtering harmful content increases and the probability of seeing harmful content in your application reduces.

outputStrength.documentation: The strength of the content filter to apply to model responses. As you increase the filter strength, the likelihood of filtering harmful content increases and the probability of seeing harmful content in your application reduces.

GuardrailContentFilterConfig.documentation:
Contains filter strengths for harmful content. Guardrails support the following content filters to detect and filter harmful user inputs and FM-generated outputs.

  • Hate – Describes language or a statement that discriminates, criticizes, insults, denounces, or dehumanizes a person or group on the basis of an identity (such as race, ethnicity, gender, religion, sexual orientation, ability, and national origin).

  • Insults – Describes language or a statement that includes demeaning, humiliating, mocking, insulting, or belittling language. This type of language is also labeled as bullying.

  • Sexual – Describes language or a statement that indicates sexual interest, activity, or arousal using direct or indirect references to body parts, physical traits, or sex.

  • Violence – Describes language or a statement that includes glorification of or threats to inflict physical pain, hurt, or injury toward a person, group or thing.

Content filtering depends on the confidence classification of user inputs and FM responses across each of the four harmful categories. All input and output statements are classified into one of four confidence levels (NONE, LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH) for each harmful category. For example, if a statement is classified as Hate with HIGH confidence, the likelihood of the statement representing hateful content is high. A single statement can be classified across multiple categories with varying confidence levels. For example, a single statement can be classified as Hate with HIGH confidence, Insults with LOW confidence, Sexual with NONE confidence, and Violence with MEDIUM confidence.

For more information, see Guardrails content filters.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • CreateGuardrail request body

  • UpdateGuardrail request body

filters.documentation: Contains the type of the content filter and how strongly it should apply to prompts and model responses.

GuardrailContentPolicy.documentation:
Contains details about how to handle harmful content.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • GetGuardrail response body

filtersConfig.documentation: Contains the type of the content filter and how strongly it should apply to prompts and model responses.

GuardrailContentPolicyConfig.documentation:
Contains details about how to handle harmful content.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • CreateGuardrail request body

  • UpdateGuardrail request body

type.documentation: ManagedWords$type The managed word type that was configured for the guardrail. (For now, we only offer profanity word list)

GuardrailManagedWords.documentation: The managed word list that was configured for the guardrail. (This is a list of words that are pre-defined and managed by Guardrails only.)

type.documentation: The managed word type to configure for the guardrail.

GuardrailManagedWordsConfig.documentation: The managed word list to configure for the guardrail.

type.documentation: The type of PII entity. For example, Social Security Number.

action.documentation: The configured guardrail action when PII entity is detected.

GuardrailPiiEntity.documentation: The PII entity configured for the guardrail.

type.documentation: Configure guardrail type when the PII entity is detected.

action.documentation: Configure guardrail action when the PII entity is detected.

GuardrailPiiEntityConfig.documentation: The PII entity to configure for the guardrail.

name.documentation: The name of the regular expression for the guardrail.

description.documentation: The description of the regular expression for the guardrail.

pattern.documentation: The pattern of the regular expression configured for the guardrail.

action.documentation: The action taken when a match to the regular expression is detected.

GuardrailRegex.documentation: The regular expression configured for the guardrail.

name.documentation: The name of the regular expression to configure for the guardrail.

description.documentation: The description of the regular expression to configure for the guardrail.

pattern.documentation: The regular expression pattern to configure for the guardrail.

action.documentation: The guardrail action to configure when matching regular expression is detected.

GuardrailRegexConfig.documentation: The regular expression to configure for the guardrail.

piiEntities.documentation: The list of PII entities configured for the guardrail.

regexes.documentation: The list of regular expressions configured for the guardrail.

GuardrailSensitiveInformationPolicy.documentation: Contains details about PII entities and regular expressions configured for the guardrail.

piiEntitiesConfig.documentation: A list of PII entities to configure to the guardrail.

regexesConfig.documentation: A list of regular expressions to configure to the guardrail.

GuardrailSensitiveInformationPolicyConfi.documentation: Contains details about PII entities and regular expressions to configure for the guardrail.

createdAt.documentation: The date and time at which the guardrail was created.

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time at which the guardrail was last updated.

GuardrailSummary.documentation:
Contains details about a guardrail.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • ListGuardrails response body

name.documentation: The name of the topic to deny.

definition.documentation: A definition of the topic to deny.

examples.documentation: A list of prompts, each of which is an example of a prompt that can be categorized as belonging to the topic.

GuardrailTopic.documentation:
Details about topics for the guardrail to identify and deny.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • GetGuardrail response body

name.documentation: The name of the topic to deny.

definition.documentation: A definition of the topic to deny.

examples.documentation: A list of prompts, each of which is an example of a prompt that can be categorized as belonging to the topic.

GuardrailTopicConfig.documentation:
Details about topics for the guardrail to identify and deny.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • UpdateGuardrail request body

topics.documentation: A list of policies related to topics that the guardrail should deny.

Contains details about topics that the guardrail should identify and deny.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • GetGuardrail response body

topicsConfig.documentation: A list of policies related to topics that the guardrail should deny.

GuardrailTopicPolicyConfig.documentation:
Contains details about topics that the guardrail should identify and deny.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • CreateGuardrail request body

text.documentation: Text of the word configured for the guardrail to block.
Text of the word configured for the guardrail to block.

GuardrailWordConfig.documentation: A word to configure for the guardrail.

words.documentation: A list of words configured for the guardrail.

managedWordLists.documentation: A list of managed words configured for the guardrail.

GuardrailWordPolicy.documentation: Contains details about the word policy configured for the guardrail.

wordsConfig.documentation: A list of words to configure for the guardrail.

managedWordListsConfig.documentation: A list of managed words to configure for the guardrail.

GuardrailWordPolicyConfig.documentation: Contains details about the word policy to configured for the guardrail.

customMetrics.documentation: A HumanEvaluationCustomMetric object. It contains the names the metrics, how the metrics are to be evaluated, an optional description.

datasetMetricConfigs.documentation: Use to specify the metrics, task, and prompt dataset to be used in your model evaluation job.

HumanEvaluationConfig.documentation:
Specifies the custom metrics, how tasks will be rated, the flow definition ARN, and your custom prompt datasets. Model evaluation jobs use human workers only support the use of custom prompt datasets. To learn more about custom prompt datasets and the required format, see Custom prompt datasets.

When you create custom metrics in HumanEvaluationCustomMetric you must specify the metric's name. The list of names specified in the HumanEvaluationCustomMetric array, must match the metricNames array of strings specified in EvaluationDatasetMetricConfig. For example, if in the HumanEvaluationCustomMetric array your specified the names "accuracy", "toxicity", "readability" as custom metrics then the metricNames array would need to look like the following ["accuracy", "toxicity", "readability"] in EvaluationDatasetMetricConfig.

name.documentation: The name of the metric. Your human evaluators will see this name in the evaluation UI.

description.documentation: An optional description of the metric. Use this parameter to provide more details about the metric.

ratingMethod.documentation: Choose how you want your human workers to evaluation your model. Valid values for rating methods are ThumbsUpDown, IndividualLikertScale,ComparisonLikertScale, ComparisonChoice, and ComparisonRank

HumanEvaluationCustomMetric.documentation: In a model evaluation job that uses human workers you must define the name of the metric, and how you want that metric rated ratingMethod, and an optional description of the metric.

flowDefinitionArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Number (ARN) for the flow definition

HumanWorkflowConfig.documentation: Contains SageMakerFlowDefinition object. The object is used to specify the prompt dataset, task type, rating method and metric names.

InternalServerException.documentation: An internal server error occurred. Retry your request.

creationTimeBefore.documentation: Return custom models created before the specified time.

creationTimeAfter.documentation: Return custom models created after the specified time.

nameContains.documentation: Return custom models only if the job name contains these characters.

baseModelArnEquals.documentation: Return custom models only if the base model Amazon Resource Name (ARN) matches this parameter.

foundationModelArnEquals.documentation: Return custom models only if the foundation model Amazon Resource Name (ARN) matches this parameter.

maxResults.documentation: Maximum number of results to return in the response.

nextToken.documentation: Continuation token from the previous response, for Amazon Bedrock to list the next set of results.

sortBy.documentation: The field to sort by in the returned list of models.

nextToken.documentation: Continuation token for the next request to list the next set of results.

creationTimeAfter.documentation: A filter that includes model evaluation jobs created after the time specified.

creationTimeBefore.documentation: A filter that includes model evaluation jobs created prior to the time specified.

statusEquals.documentation: Only return jobs where the status condition is met.

nameContains.documentation: Query parameter string for model evaluation job names.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return.

nextToken.documentation: Continuation token from the previous response, for Amazon Bedrock to list the next set of results.

sortBy.documentation: Allows you to sort model evaluation jobs by when they were created.

sortOrder.documentation: How you want the order of jobs sorted.

nextToken.documentation: Continuation token from the previous response, for Amazon Bedrock to list the next set of results.

jobSummaries.documentation: A summary of the model evaluation jobs.

byProvider.documentation: Return models belonging to the model provider that you specify.

byCustomizationType.documentation: Return models that support the customization type that you specify. For more information, see Custom models in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

byOutputModality.documentation: Return models that support the output modality that you specify.

byInferenceType.documentation: Return models that support the inference type that you specify. For more information, see Provisioned Throughput in the Amazon Bedrock User Guide.

modelSummaries.documentation: A list of Amazon Bedrock foundation models.

maxResults.documentation: The maximum number of results to return in the response.

nextToken.documentation: If there are more results than were returned in the response, the response returns a nextToken that you can send in another ListGuardrails request to see the next batch of results.

guardrails.documentation: A list of objects, each of which contains details about a guardrail.

nextToken.documentation: If there are more results than were returned in the response, the response returns a nextToken that you can send in another ListGuardrails request to see the next batch of results.

creationTimeAfter.documentation: Return customization jobs created after the specified time.

creationTimeBefore.documentation: Return customization jobs created before the specified time.

statusEquals.documentation: Return customization jobs with the specified status.

nameContains.documentation: Return customization jobs only if the job name contains these characters.

maxResults.documentation: Maximum number of results to return in the response.

nextToken.documentation: Continuation token from the previous response, for Amazon Bedrock to list the next set of results.

sortBy.documentation: The field to sort by in the returned list of jobs.

nextToken.documentation: Page continuation token to use in the next request.

creationTimeAfter.documentation: A filter that returns Provisioned Throughputs created after the specified time.

creationTimeBefore.documentation: A filter that returns Provisioned Throughputs created before the specified time.

statusEquals.documentation: A filter that returns Provisioned Throughputs if their statuses matches the value that you specify.

modelArnEquals.documentation: A filter that returns Provisioned Throughputs whose model Amazon Resource Name (ARN) is equal to the value that you specify.

nameContains.documentation: A filter that returns Provisioned Throughputs if their name contains the expression that you specify.

maxResults.documentation: THe maximum number of results to return in the response. If there are more results than the number you specified, the response returns a nextToken value. To see the next batch of results, send the nextToken value in another list request.

nextToken.documentation: If there are more results than the number you specified in the maxResults field, the response returns a nextToken value. To see the next batch of results, specify the nextToken value in this field.

sortBy.documentation: The field by which to sort the returned list of Provisioned Throughputs.

nextToken.documentation: If there are more results than the number you specified in the maxResults field, this value is returned. To see the next batch of results, include this value in the nextToken field in another list request.

provisionedModelSummaries.documentation: A list of summaries, one for each Provisioned Throughput in the response.

resourceARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource.

tags.documentation: An array of the tags associated with this resource.

textDataDeliveryEnabled.documentation: Set to include text data in the log delivery.

imageDataDeliveryEnabled.documentation: Set to include image data in the log delivery.

embeddingDataDeliveryEnabled.documentation: Set to include embeddings data in the log delivery.

jobArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customization job.

baseModelArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the base model.

lastModifiedTime.documentation: Time that the customization job was last modified.

customModelArn.documentation: Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom model.

customizationType.documentation: Specifies whether to carry out continued pre-training of a model or whether to fine-tune it. For more information, see Custom models.

s3Uri.documentation: The S3 URI where the output data is stored.

provisionedModelArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Provisioned Throughput.

modelArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the model associated with the Provisioned Throughput.

desiredModelArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the model requested to be associated to this Provisioned Throughput. This value differs from the modelArn if updating hasn't completed.

foundationModelArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the base model for which the Provisioned Throughput was created, or of the base model that the custom model for which the Provisioned Throughput was created was customized.

modelUnits.documentation: The number of model units allocated to the Provisioned Throughput.

desiredModelUnits.documentation: The number of model units that was requested to be allocated to the Provisioned Throughput.

commitmentDuration.documentation: The duration for which the Provisioned Throughput was committed.

commitmentExpirationTime.documentation: The timestamp for when the commitment term of the Provisioned Throughput expires.

creationTime.documentation: The time that the Provisioned Throughput was created.

lastModifiedTime.documentation: The time that the Provisioned Throughput was last modified.

ProvisionedModelSummary.documentation:
A summary of information about a Provisioned Throughput.

This data type is used in the following API operations:

  • ListProvisionedThroughputs response

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: The specified resource Amazon Resource Name (ARN) was not found. Check the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) and try your request again.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.documentation: The number of requests exceeds the service quota. Resubmit your request later.

jobIdentifier.documentation: The ARN of the model evaluation job you want to stop.
Job identifier of the job to stop.

Tag.documentation: Definition of the key/value pair for a tag.

resourceARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to tag.

ThrottlingException.documentation: The number of requests exceeds the limit. Resubmit your request later.

resourceName.documentation: The name of the resource with too many tags.

TooManyTagsException.documentation: The request contains more tags than can be associated with a resource (50 tags per resource). The maximum number of tags includes both existing tags and those included in your current request.

s3Uri.documentation: The S3 URI where the training data is stored.

trainingLoss.documentation: Loss metric associated with the custom job.

resourceARN.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to untag.

tagKeys.documentation: Tag keys of the tags to remove from the resource.

topicPolicyConfig.documentation: The topic policy to configure for the guardrail.

contentPolicyConfig.documentation: The content policy to configure for the guardrail.

wordPolicyConfig.documentation: The word policy to configure for the guardrail.

sensitiveInformationPolicyConfig.documentation: The sensitive information policy to configure for the guardrail.

blockedInputMessaging.documentation: The message to return when the guardrail blocks a prompt.

blockedOutputsMessaging.documentation: The message to return when the guardrail blocks a model response.

kmsKeyId.documentation: The ARN of the KMS key with which to encrypt the guardrail.

guardrailArn.documentation: The ARN of the guardrail that was created.

updatedAt.documentation: The date and time at which the guardrail was updated.

provisionedModelId.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or name of the Provisioned Throughput to update.

desiredProvisionedModelName.documentation: The new name for this Provisioned Throughput.

desiredModelId.documentation:
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the new model to associate with this Provisioned Throughput. You can't specify this field if this Provisioned Throughput is associated with a base model.

If this Provisioned Throughput is associated with a custom model, you can specify one of the following options:

  • The base model from which the custom model was customized.

  • Another custom model that was customized from the same base model as the custom model.

ValidationException.documentation: Input validation failed. Check your request parameters and retry the request.

s3Uri.documentation: The S3 URI where the validation data is stored.

validationLoss.documentation: The validation loss associated with this validator.

documentation: Describes the API operations for creating, managing, fine-turning, and evaluating Amazon Bedrock models.
